name: 吳冠毅
objective: In the first semester, this course first introduces the core areas of physical chemistry by defining systems, states, and processes. Later, traditional thermodynamics is described and applied to understand the reaction spontaneous direction of macroscopic systems, including the explanation of the three laws of thermodynamics, to the description of thermodynamic behavior applied to gaseous and liquid systems.
schedule:
1.	The properties of gases-Pressure (P), Volume (V) and Temperature (T)
2.	The zeroth law of thermodynamics & Kelvin temperature scale
3.	The first law of thermodynamics-
4.	Heat, Work, and energy.
5.	Internal energy, enthalpy
6.	Heat capacity and internal pressure
7.	Thermochemistry
8.	The second law of thermodynamics-Heat energy & the concept of entropy
9.	Mid-term exam
10.	Equilibrium and spontaneity
11.	The third law of thermodynamics
12.	Entropy changes for specific processes
13.	The Helmholtz and Gibbs free energies
14.	Combining the First and Second Laws
15.	Phase equilibrium
16.	Physical transformations, mixing, and Colligative properties
17.	Chemical equilibrium
18.	Final exam

The schedule is dependent on the actual progress of lesson.
scorePolicy:
Attendance: 15 
Mid-term exam(I): 20
Mid-term exam(II):30
Final exam: 35
materials: Textbook: Physical Chemistry, International Edition, Peter Atkins (滄海書局)
